algorithms.imageProcessing.util

Class RANSACAlgorithmIterations

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.imageProcessing.util.RANSACAlgorithmIterations

  • public class RANSACAlgorithmIterations
extends java.lang.Object
    estimates the number of iterations for a RANSAC type algorithm that should be used to ensure with 95% certainty that a set of points is findable as a subset of n matchable points.
    Author:
    nichole

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RANSACAlgorithmIterations() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int estimateNIterForFifteenPercentOutliersFor2Points(int nPoints)
      The estimate assumes that at least 15 percent of the nPoints are true matches with points in another set of points and determines the number of iterations needed for a 95% certainty that 2 points drawn randomly from nPoints will all be "truly matchable" with points in set2 (whose characteristics are presumed to be similar).
      int estimateNIterForFiftyPercentOutliersFor7Points(int nMatchedPoints)
      The estimate assumes that at least 50 percent of the nMatchedPoints are outliers and determines the number of iterations needed for a 95% certainty that 7 points drawn randomly from nMatchedPoints will all be "true" matches, that is, not outliers.
      int estimateNIterForFiftyPercentOutliersFor8Points(int nMatchedPoints)
      The estimate assumes that at least 50 percent of the nMatchedPoints are outliers and determines the number of iterations needed for a 95% certainty that 8 points drawn randomly from nMatchedPoints will all be "true" matches, that is, not outliers.
      int estimateNIterForTwentyFivePercentOutliersFor8Points(int nMatchedPoints)
      The estimate assumes that at least 25 percent of the nMatchedPoints are outliers and determines the number of iterations needed for a 95% certainty that 8 points drawn randomly from nMatchedPoints will all be "true" matches, that is, not outliers.
      int estimateNIterUsingStandardRANSACApproximation(double probabilityOfInliers, int nSubset)
      using estimates for the number of iterations required to lower the probability that a set of nSet inliers is not found to 1-0.95=0.05 from: http://6.869.csail.mit.edu/fa12/lectures/lecture13ransac/lecture13ransac.pdf Note: this assumes that the user's nPoints >> nIter.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • estimateNIterForTwentyFivePercentOutliersFor8Points

        public int estimateNIterForTwentyFivePercentOutliersFor8Points(int nMatchedPoints)
        The estimate assumes that at least 25 percent of the nMatchedPoints are outliers and determines the number of iterations needed for a 95% certainty that 8 points drawn randomly from nMatchedPoints will all be "true" matches, that is, not outliers. 
             It uses this table generated below following the statistics in the comments
     at the end of this class.
     
                    | nInliers percentage of nTotal
     nMatchedPoints |   50       75       100
     ------------------------------------------------------
       30   |       | 0.001  | 0.05   |  1.0
       50   |       | 0.002  | 0.07   |  1.0
      100   |       | 0.003  | 0.09   |  1.0
      500   |       | 0.004  | 0.1    |  1.0
     1000   |       | 0.004  | 0.1    |  1.0
        Parameters:
        nMatchedPoints -
        Returns:

      • estimateNIterForFiftyPercentOutliersFor8Points

        public int estimateNIterForFiftyPercentOutliersFor8Points(int nMatchedPoints)
        The estimate assumes that at least 50 percent of the nMatchedPoints are outliers and determines the number of iterations needed for a 95% certainty that 8 points drawn randomly from nMatchedPoints will all be "true" matches, that is, not outliers. 
             It uses this table generated below following the statistics in the comments
     at the end of this class.
     
                    | nInliers percentage of nTotal
     nMatchedPoints |   50       75       100
     ------------------------------------------------------
       30   |       | 0.001  | 0.05   |  1.0
       50   |       | 0.002  | 0.07   |  1.0

      500   |       | 0.004  | 0.1    |  1.0

      • estimateNIterForFiftyPercentOutliersFor7Points

        public int estimateNIterForFiftyPercentOutliersFor7Points(int nMatchedPoints)
        The estimate assumes that at least 50 percent of the nMatchedPoints are outliers and determines the number of iterations needed for a 95% certainty that 7 points drawn randomly from nMatchedPoints will all be "true" matches, that is, not outliers. 
             It uses this table generated below following the statistics in the comments
     at the end of this class.
     
                    | nInliers percentage of nTotal
     nMatchedPoints |   50       75       100
     ------------------------------------------------------
       30   |       | 0.003  | 0.084  |  1.0
       50   |       | 0.0048 | 0.10   |  1.0
      100   |       | 0.006  | 0.124  |  1.0
      500   |       | 0.0075 | 0.132  |  1.0
     1000   |       | 0.0076 | 0.133  |  1.0
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • estimateNIterForFifteenPercentOutliersFor2Points

        public int estimateNIterForFifteenPercentOutliersFor2Points(int nPoints)
        The estimate assumes that at least 15 percent of the nPoints are true matches with points in another set of points and determines the number of iterations needed for a 95% certainty that 2 points drawn randomly from nPoints will all be "truly matchable" with points in set2 (whose characteristics are presumed to be similar). 
             It uses this table generated below following the statistics in the comments
     at the end of this class.
     
             | nInliers percentage of nTotal
     nPoints |  15        25       50       75
     ------------------------------------------------------
       30    | 0.014  | 0.05   | 0.24   |  0.53
       50    | 0.017  | 0.054  | 0.245  |  0.54
      100    | 0.021  | 0.061  | 0.247  |  0.56
      177    | 0.021  | 0.061  | 0.246  |  0.56
      500    | 0.022  | 0.062  | 0.25   |  0.56
     1000    | 0.022  | 0.062  | 0.25   |  0.56
        Parameters:
        nPoints -
        Returns:

      • estimateNIterUsingStandardRANSACApproximation

        public int estimateNIterUsingStandardRANSACApproximation(double probabilityOfInliers,
                                                         int nSubset)
        using estimates for the number of iterations required to lower the probability that a set of nSet inliers is not found to 1-0.95=0.05 from: http://6.869.csail.mit.edu/fa12/lectures/lecture13ransac/lecture13ransac.pdf Note: this assumes that the user's nPoints >> nIter. g = probability of inliers in pairs of (unmatchedLeftXY, unmatchedRightXY) p = nSet 0.05 = (1 - g^p)^nIter log(0.05) = nIter * log(1 - g^p) ==> nIter = log(0.05) / log(1 - g^p) for g=0.5 and p=7, nIter = 382. int nIter = (int)Math.ceil(Math.log(0.05)/Math.log(1 - Math.pow(g, nSet)));
        Returns:
